item.title: 1664 winter campaign
item.description: burned the bridge at Eszek Battle at Szengotthárd

item.title: Bethlen Gábor
item.description: rose to power with Turkish support → unpopular

item.title: Bocskai István
item.description: [!info] Role of [[Transylvanian Principality]] to aid Hungary against Habsburg rulers reunificiation [[Bocskai Revolt]]

item.title: Bátori István
item.description: Polish king → attempted unification of Hungary and [[Transylvanian Principality]]

item.title: Estates of the Transylvanian Principality
item.description: nobles of Hungarian counties nobles of Szekler Sees burghers of Saxon Sees

item.title: Habsburg Ferdinánd
item.description: born:: 1487.02.02 died:: 1540.07.22 nationality:: Austrian office:: king Family His wife was [[Louis II]]’s sister and his sister was Louis’ widow

item.title: Mohács
item.description: Consequences Most of the nobles were killed. Ceased to be a regional great power. Buda was ransacked Struggle for power between nobles increased in the wake of the defeat.

item.title: palatine
item.description: [!info] Role protect the privileges of nobles act as king

item.title: Szapolyai János Zsigmond
item.description: born:: 1487.02.02 died:: 1540.07.22 nationality:: Hungarian office::voivod, king

item.title: Szigetvár
item.description: Battle lead to peace treaty between the Habsburgs and [[Suleiman I]], [[Treaty of Edirne]]

item.title: Transylvanian Principality
item.description: Vassal state yearly tax no war without the Sultan’s permission the Sultan had to consent to a new prince [[Estates of the Transylvanian Principality]]

item.title: Treaty of Várad
item.description: Whether or not he has an heir, after [[Szapolyai János Zsigmond]]’s death, [[Habsburg Ferdinánd]] would become king [!

item.title: Tripartition
item.description: ![[History 01.10]] [[Habsburg Ferdinánd]] v. [[Szapolyai János Zsigmond]] v. [[Suleiman I]] Szapolyai was elected king as the Diet of Székesfehérvár in 1526 decreed that the king must be Hungarian.

item.title: Zrínyi Miklós
item.description: poet and political writer Called on Hungarians to liberate the country Hungary on their own ← Habsburgs fighting France ([[XIV.
